Title: £10 billion North Wales AI Growth Zone
Description: £10 billion investment into North Wales creating  thousands of jobs and long-term AI economy for the next generation.

Title: £10 billion+ South Wales AI Growth Zone
Description: £10bn+ local investment creating 5,000+ jobs with Wales’ industrial heritage powering an ambitious AI future.

Title: £3.9bn Investment from Equinix in Hertfordshire
Description: Major datacentre investment in the UK

Title: £100 million Groq Investment
Description: £100million from Groq, a leading AI chip company, opening its first datacentre in the UK

Title: Graphcore doubles UK Headcount
Description: Graphcore, the UK’s AI chip powerhouse is doubling its UK headcount and building a new AI Development Lab near Bristol.

Title: £150 million AI Pathfinder Investment
Description: AI Pathfinder, a new UK AI emerging hyperscaler, announcing a £150m investment in the UK

Title: £80m Perplexity Investment
Description: Expansion of Perplexity’s offices in London, creating exceptional AI jobs

Title: AI leader, Cursor, opening new office
Description: Coding AI platform Cursor opening its first UK office

Title: Cerebras office opening
Description: Leading AI chip maker, Cerebras, announcing UK partnership as part of Cerebras for Nations, as well as a London office opening

Title: £100 million for Advance Market Compute
Description: A world-first Advance Market Commitment for novel compute, using £100m to back public research and British startups

Title: £250 million compute for British Researchers
Description: Launching £250m of compute capacity for British researchers. Backing our talent with the chips that will power the British AI economy.

Title: AI Ambassadors
Description: Founder of Monzo Tom Blomfield, Head of Deepmind AI research Raia Hadsell, and Nobel winner Simon Johnson - will all join forces with UK government to shape the most audacious British AI future

Title: Sovereign AI
Description: James Wise, Partner at multibillion pound UK VC Balderton Capital, will become Chair of the UK Sovereign AI Taskforce, working to make the future of AI distinctly British

Title: AI for Science strategy
Description: Our AI for Science strategy launches an audacious mission to create new drugs and tackle life-threatening diseases, backed with £137m

Title: AI Growth Labs
Description: "A new blueprint for AI regulation will introduce safe
Category: supervised sandboxes. This aims to accelerate responsible AI innovation
column5: and support applications in sectors including healthcare

Title: UK-Netherlands Innovation Partnership
Description: We’ve signed a new UK-Netherlands Innovation Partnership to deepen ties on AI, quantum and semiconductors

Title: OpenAI<>Ministry of Justice Data Hosting Partnership
Description: Through an ongoing partnership with the Ministry of Justice, OpenAI will enable UK organisations to store data on secure British servers for the first time. AI tools across the Ministry of Justice are expected to save up to 240,000 days of staff time each year.

Title: £8.9 million Regulatory Innovation Office funding package
Description: The Government is providing an £8.9 million boost for 16 projects to cut outdated red tape, so that the UK’s innovators can get new technologies out of the lab and into use sooner.

Title: North East AI Growth Zone
Description: The North East’s AI Growth Zone is set to unlock up to £30 billion in private investment and more than 5,000 new jobs

Title: £31 billion UK–US Tech Prosperity Deal
Description: The UK and US agreed a historic technology partnership focused on AI, quantum and nuclear, backed by more than £31 billion in new commitments to UK AI infrastructure and cutting-edge tech, from top firms like Microsoft, NVIDIA, Google, OpenAI and CoreWeave.

Title: £4m investment in AI crime prevention system
Description: The Government launched “Concentrations of Crime Data Challenge”, with an initial £4m investment, to develop a real-time, interactive crime mapping system for England and Wales by 2030.

Title: £500m Local Innovation Partnerships Fund
Description: Local leaders across the UK to be backed by at least £30 million each, to help target science and tech funding towards regional strengths.

Title: $1 million Open-Source AI Fellowship
Description: The Government, backed by a $1 million Meta grant to the Alan Turing Institute, launched a 12-month Open-Source AI Fellowship: to bring top AI experts into government to build open-source AI tools that improve public services, boost productivity, and support national security.

Title: Google Cloud partnership to upskill 100,000 civil servants
Description: New partnership with Google Cloud will help modernise outdated government IT, upskill 100,000 civil servants in digital and AI by 2030, and secure better tech deals for the taxpayer.

Title: UK launches global talent drive backed by £54 million
Description: A new Global Talent Taskforce and £54 million fund will support researchers, entrepreneurs, investors, top tier managerial and engineering talent to relocate to Britain.

Title: Scotland to host the UK’s most powerful supercomputer
Description: £750 million has been confirmed to build the UK’s most powerful supercomputer in Edinburgh, giving scientists across the UK access to compute power found in only a handful of other nations.

Title: Turing AI ‘Global’ Fellowships
Description: £25 million was confirmed to launch the Turing AI ‘Global’ Fellowships, aimed at attracting five top AI experts to the UK to relocate, build teams and conduct frontier AI research.

Title: Encode: AI for Science Fellowship
Description: "Conceived and delivered by Pillar VC
Category: enabled by ARIA and funded by Government
Date: the programme embeds world-class AI researchers into cutting-edge scientific labs
column6: and enabling talent to spend one year immersed in intensive exploration

Title: AI Opportunities Action Plan unveiled to turbocharge UK growth
Description: The Prime Minister committed to all 50 recommendations in the AI Opportunities Action Plan, including boosting public compute capacity, accelerating AI adoption across government and industry, and securing more than £14 billion in private investment and over 13,000 jobs to drive the Plan for Change.

Title: £6.3 billion global investment in UK data centres
Description: US firms CyrusOne, ServiceNow, CloudHQ and CoreWeave committed to the UK as the place to invest in data centres.

Title: £32 million AI boost for public services and productivity
Description: Funding for 98 AI projects, improving rail, healthcare, construction training and supply chains across the UK.
